Quicklinks

2026 CITY ELECTION

Councilmember/Alderman Positions 3, 4 and Mayor are scheduled for the City of Piney Point ballot on May 2, 2026.  Each member serves a two-year term.

**May 2, 2026 General Election Notice (Aviso de Elecciones para el 2026)**

**[Notice of Deadline to File Applications for Place on the Ballot](https://www.cityofpineypoint.com/upload/page/0147/ElectionNotice2File4Place2026_Redacted1.pdf)**

****[2026 Candidate Packets](https://www.cityofpineypoint.com/upload/page/0147/2026-Candidate-Packet%20For%20Web%20R%20012226.pdf) (Paquete de Candidato del 2026)****

**2026 Candidate Packet - [Short Version](https://www.cityofpineypoint.com/upload/page/0147/2026-Candidate-Packet%20For%20Web%20Short%20Version.pdf) - (Paquete Versión Abreviada)**

2025 CITY ELECTION

*There is no General Election for council positions selected for May 2025 as they were unopposed.**[ORD 2025.03-A1](https://www.cityofpineypoint.com/upload/page/0147/ORD%202025.03.A1%20Elect%20Unopposed.pdf)*
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Councilmember/Alderman Positions 1, 2, and 5 are on the ballot for May 3, 2025. Each member serves a two-year term.

Interested candidates may file for an application for a place on the ballot with Robert Pennington or Michelle Yi, Early Voting Clerks, during regular office hours 8:00 AM – 4:30 PM, from January 15 – February 14, 2025, by submitting the required forms at Piney Point Village City Hall at 7660 Woodway, Suite 460; Houston, Texas 77063.  Note that this is a new location than in prior years. The deadline for candidates to file is 5:00 PM on February 14, 2025.

**May 3, 2025 General Election Notice (Aviso de Elecciones para el 2025)**

**[Notice of Deadline to File Applications for Place on the Ballot](https://www.cityofpineypoint.com/upload/page/0147/docs/Election/Notice%20of%20Deadline%202-1f%20Web.pdf)**

**[2025 Candidate Packets](https://www.cityofpineypoint.com/upload/page/0147/docs/Election/2025_Candidate_Packet_for_Web.pdf) (Paquete de Candidato del 2025)**

**2025 Candidate Packet - [Short Version (Paquete](https://www.cityofpineypoint.com/upload/page/0147/docs/Election/2025%20Candidate%20Packet%20-%20Short%20Ver.pdf) - Versión Abreviada)**

2024 General Election Results (Unofficial)
------------------------------------------

Councilmember/Alderman Positions 3, 4 and Mayor are scheduled for the City of Piney Point ballot on May 4, 2024.  Each member serves a two-year term. Candidate registration for this election has closed.

**Results will be updated throughout the tabulation process:**

* Running for **Mayor,** listed in the order in which they will appear on the ballot are **Aliza Dutt** and **Jonathan C. Curth.**Aliza Dutt received 492 (unofficial) votes.  
  Jonathan C. Curth received 315 (unofficial) votes.
* Running for Councilmember/Alderman **Position 3** is incumbent **Joel A. Bender**, who is running unopposed.  
  Joel A. Bender received 606 (unofficial) votes.
* Running for Councilmember/Alderman **Position 4**is ****Margaret Rohde****, who is running unopposed.  
  Margaret Rohde received 598 (unofficial) votes.

For the unofficial detailed results, [Click Here](https://www.cityofpineypoint.com/upload/page/0147/2024%20Election%20Results.pdf).

### May 4, 2024 Council positions up for election:

Candidates running for Piney Point Village are listed by place and in the order in which they will appear on the ballot:

**Mayor**

* Aliza Dutt ([Application](https://www.cityofpineypoint.com/upload/page/0147/Dutt%20-%20Mayor.pdf), [Finance](https://www.cityofpineypoint.com/upload/page/0147/Dutt%20Finance%20Report.pdf))
* Jonathan C. Curth ([Application](https://www.cityofpineypoint.com/upload/page/0147/JCurth.pdf), [Finance](https://www.cityofpineypoint.com/upload/page/0147/20240403195141.pdf))

**Alderman Position 3**

* Joel A. Bender ([Application](https://www.cityofpineypoint.com/upload/page/0147/scan0003.pdf))

**Alderman Position 4**

* Margaret Rohde  ([Application](https://www.cityofpineypoint.com/upload/page/0147/Rohde%20-%20Place%204.pdf))

Additional Information on the May 4, 2024 Election can be found on the Spring Branch Independent School District website. Click [here](https://www.springbranchisd.com/about/board-of-trustees/elections/current-elections) for additional information.

### VOTING BY MAIL

Applications for ballots by mail must be received no later than April 23, 2024 by 5:00 o'clock p.m.  
To be eligible to vote by mail in Texas, one of the following criteria must apply:

* be 65 years or older;
* be sick or disabled;
* be out of the county on election day and during the early voting period; or
* be expected to give birth within three weeks before or after Election Day; or
* be confined in jail, but otherwise eligible

Voting by Mail Information  - *Please see Joint Notice and Information linked above.*

### EARLY VOTING LOCATIONS:

Piney Point Village will conduct joint elections with Spring Branch Independent School District. An early voting polling place will be located at 325 Piney Point Road. Voting will take place from April 22 to April 26, 2024, between 8:00 a.m. and 4:00 p.m. In addition, early voting is scheduled for April 29 and April 30, 2024, from 7:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m. *Note that the former location at 7676 Woodway will not be available as a polling place due to ongoing improvements to the facility*. Click [here](https://resources.finalsite.net/images/f_auto,q_auto/v1709832387/springbranchisdcom/b1ushwzyujdq69xjvhey/2024EVLocations.jpg) for a list of early voting locations.

**NOTE**: Early voting for City of Piney Point Village location is at Ecclesia, 325 Piney Point Rd., Houston, TX 77024, will be held April 22 - April 30:

* April 22 – April 26: 8 a.m. – 4 p.m.
* No Saturday, April 27 Early Voting
* April 29 – April 30: 7 a.m. – 7 p.m.

*If voting by mail, applications for ballots by mail must be received no later than 5 p.m. on April 23 .*

**Election Day Voting**  
*by the Middle School Attendance Zone*  
Saturday, May 4, 2024  
7:00 a.m. - 7:00 p.m.

[Election Day Voting Locations - SBISD/PPV Directory of Street Addresses](https://resources.finalsite.net/images/v1713741151/springbranchisdcom/yxsgupalkepjeaglbbnu/sbisd_street_index.pdf)  
Voting locations are based on middle school attendance zones and home street address.

* Precinct No. 43 – Spring Branch Middle School, 1000 Piney Point, Houston, TX 77024.
